Comment: Hi everyone, just to share another good result in my 1700-1800 tournament.  I have now managed 4 points out of the first 5 games, with 3 wins and 2 draws.  This is my latest win.  We start off with a standard Ruy Lopez leading to a variation called the Leonhardt Variation.
5. ......... Be7 - a conservative developing move, clearing the way for kingside castling.  This is the start of the Leonhardt Variation.

18. d4 - a move which strikes out in the centre but the downside is is that as a result of a plethora of exchanges, his e4 pawn is going to be very weak.  This factor will swing the game in my favour.

24. ......... Rde8 - hope you can all follow that frenetic action!  I decided to double rooks on the e file and keep up the pressure on b2.  Crucially my hind rook moves onto a white square so that black's dsb cannot fork it against my knight on the rim.
